News: ['Global share markets were also sharply lower on Friday, marking their worst week since the 2008 global financial crisis and bringing the wipeout in value terms to $5 trillion.', "Moneycontrol's Ravi Krishnan talks to Editor-in-Chief Santosh Nair about the market crash and its further implications.", 'Traders should remain neutral and wait for some consolidation before initiating long positions, says Mazhar Mohammad.', 'There have been only four occasions when the Sensex has suffered a loss of more than 1,000 points in a single day, February 28 was one such day.', 'In the last six days, the Sensex has come off 3,026 points and the Nifty 924 points.', "Here are the 10 biggest day crashes in Sensex's history.", 'From extreme calmness to extreme pessimism, D-Street is also a victim of the virus outbreak in other countries, says Umesh Mehta of Samco Securities.', 'Other laggards included Ashok Leyland dropping up to 6.77 percent, Mahindra and Mahindra 3.18 percent and Bajaj Auto 2.13 percent.', 'There is always catching up between markets and earnings, and market often runs ahead of the rise in earnings, markets move on expectations of earnings growth.', 'The market breadth was largely in favour of bears as more than four shares declined for every share rising on the BSE.', 'At this juncture it looks prudent on the part of traders to wait for consolidation and some signs of strength as fear factor appears to be dominating on the bourses, said Mazhar Mohammad of Chartviewindia.in.', 'HDFC Life Insurance Company, Bandhan Bank and Info Edge will be included in the Futures & Options segment effective February 28.', 'Sectorally, selling was seen in metals, realty, infra, public sector, capital goods, auto, banks, oil & gas and IT']

News: ['The key support level for Nifty is placed at 11,212.57, followed by 11,156.13. If the index moves up, key resistance levels to watch out for are 11,357.47 and 11,445.93.', 'As long as the Nifty sustains above 11,036 levels on the closing basis, one can retain a positive stance, Mazhar Mohammad says.', 'Vinod Nair, Head of Research at Geojit Financial Services said that the funds allocated by IMF and easing monetary measures are marginally supporting global markets but India is underperforming due to coronavirus cases.', 'The most active stocks included State Bank of India, YES Bank, Reliance Industries, Indiabulls Housing Finance and IRCTC.', 'Technically, the market is trying to find a bottom after a vertical fall but there is a need for some kind of relief on the Coronavirus front for the market to witness any relief rally.', 'All sectoral indices, barring Realty, traded in the green with Bank, FMCG, Pharma and IT climbing more than a percent each.', 'According to the brokerage, if there are fresh rate cuts or infusion of liquidity by global central banks then FII flows could resume into select emerging markets as and when the covid-19 virus impact fades out.', 'About 1147 shares have advanced, 799 shares declined, and 124 shares are unchanged.', 'Mounting coronavirus cases, exodus by foreign institutional investors, and RBI playing the waiting game to provide stimulus has prompted investors to exit the market.', 'The Sensex closed 61.13 points higher at 38,470.61, and the Nifty was up 18 points at 11,269.']

News: ['Considering uncertain external environment, it looks prudent on the part of traders to sit on the fence waiting for stability, Mazhar Mohammad advised.', 'The S&P BSE Sensex, Nifty and NiftyBank witnessed their biggest one-day falls in absolute terms.', 'The earlier two biggest falls of 1,624.51 points and 1,448.37 points took place in August 2015 and February 2020.', 'The market breadth was also pathetic as more than 6 shares declined for every share rising on the BSE.', 'Dow Jones futures were also down more than 4 percent, indicating sharp fall in the opening later today.', 'The investors need not worry and have to wait for further instructions from the central bank as they will be planning to raise the new funds, said Gaurav Garg of CapitalVia Global Research', 'Sectorally, carnage was visible in capital goods, metals, energy, industrials, power, and banking stocks.', 'Sensex, Nifty and Nifty Bank has posted biggest one-day fall ever in the absolute terms.', 'Moreover, 5 weeks EMA is trading around 11,550 and as long as Nifty is trading below these levels, one should trade with sell on rise strategy.']

News: ['The key support level for Nifty is placed at 10,346.57, followed by 10,234.73. If the index moves up, key resistance levels to watch out for are 10,557.67 and 10,656.93.', 'Mazhar Mohammad said investors are advised to nibble into selective stocks to build a long term portfolio.', 'If Nifty breaches 10,295 levels then it can head towards its critical supports placed in the zone of 10,100 – 9,850 levels, suggest experts.', 'Correction is expected to continue, but this is the right time to accumulate quality stocks, most of experts feel', 'About 1064 shares have advanced, 1159 shares declined, and 133 shares are unchanged.', 'Manish Chokhani said today consumer stocks were expensive, hence there would be sideways to normal correction.', 'Investors should focus on getting their allocation right. A mix of equity, debt, and gold seems to be an ideal portfolio in the current scenario.', 'Equity as an asset class has significantly outperformed other asset classes over medium to long time horizon. Precious metals such as Gold or Silver have always been viewed as a safe assets.', 'A level below 10150 could drag the Nifty towards 9,800 support, derived from 61.8% Fibonacci Fan of the swing seen from 6825 (Feb 2016 Bottom) to 12430 (Jan 2020 Top).', 'The Sensex closed 62.45 points higher at 35,697.40, while Nifty was up 6.90 points at 10,458.40.']

News: ['The key support level for Nifty is placed at 9,385.17, followed by 9,180.18. If the index moves up, key resistance levels to watch out for are 9,917.97 and 10,245.78.', 'The Sensex crashed 3,204 points intraday, before closing 2,919.26 points down at 32,778.14, the lowest since December 6, 2017.', 'Nifty index has been making lower top - lower bottom from last four weeks and saw a correction of around 1,900 points in just five trading sessions.', 'Sectorally, the S&P BSE Public Sector index fell 10%, followed by the S&P BSE Infrastructure index which was down 10.33%, and the Oil & Gas index was down 9.8%.', 'The primary reason for the fall was WHO declaring coronavirus a pandemic.', 'ITC and State Bank of India crashed over 13 percent while Axis Bank, Tata Motors and ONGC shed 10-12 percent in the afternoon trade.', 'Experts feels the markets will remain nervous till the peak of coronavirus spread is behind us.', 'The Nifty50 took a vertical fall from the high of 12,430 recorded on January 20 to 9,648, which is the intraday low as on March 12 — a fall of 22 percent', 'The stock markets have entered bear territory', 'Of the 138 PMSes covered by PMS AIF World, 120 managed to beat the benchmark Nifty.', 'The market has fallen more than 22 percent now, especially from its record high levels touched in January.', 'The Nifty50 registered a vertical selloff from 9119 recorded on March 4, 2015 to 6,825 which was the intraday low formed on 29 February 2016 which effectively translates into a drop of more than 25 percent.', 'One need not fear red, as it stands for both danger and life. So, a major correction in markets, viewed as a danger by many, should also be seen as an opportunity for the smart money, says Singh.', 'As many as 37 Nifty companies fell 10-40 percent that include names like Tata Motors, Yes Bank, Tata Steel, GAIL India, SBI, Hero MotoCorp, JSW Steel, Axis Bank, and Bharti Infratel.', 'The Sensex ended 2,919.26 points or 8.18% lower at 32778.14, while the Nifty closed at 9590.15, down 868.25 points or 8.30%.']

News: ['The options data indicates a shift in the wider trading range for the Nifty to around 9,500-10,500.', 'Mark Mobius of Mobius Capital Partners, too, said this was a good time to begin accumulating.', 'D-Street saw a steep fall when the S&P BSE Sensex fell by 3390 points or little over 10 percent while the Nifty50 plunged more than 1000 points to hit a lower circuit in trade on Friday before recovering.', 'According to Vikas Jain of Reliance Securities, there could be a timewise correction from current levels; he expects markets to trade in a broad range.', '"It is the closest to the worst in terms of fall on the basis of last 10-year data and hence the risk reward is justified to take long positions now," Gautam Shah said.', 'Indian markets crashed to the lower circuit for the first time in 12 years after 2008 crisis, halting trading for 45 minutes. The Sensex and Nifty have since recovered nearly 13% from the low', 'Agrawal says he is fully invested, for others, it is a good time to redesign portfolio with quality shares.', 'The volatility index surged over 37 percent at 56.51 level.', 'If you think that the present global selloff, which has put the Indian market in a bearish phase, is the worst, don’t forget the 2008 financial meltdown.', 'The index-based market-wide circuit breaker system applies at three stages of the index movement, either way-- at 10%, 15% and 20%.', 'The Nifty50 breaches 8800 levels for the first time since February 2017, to a 3-year low. The S&P BSE Sensex plunged more than 3000 points to a 3-year low on Friday.', 'Trends on SGX Nifty indicate a negative opening for the index in India with a 705 points loss. The Nifty futures were trading flat at 8,774 on the Singaporean Exchange around 08:00 hours IST.', 'State Bank of India, Tata Steel and HDFC are the top gainers while SBI, Reliance Industries and HDFC Bank are the most active stocks.', 'The zone of 9,500–9,000 could act as strong support for the markets from here. If this support is held in the coming sessions, then we are of the opinion that some stability is likely to return to the markets.']

News: ['"External cues are more important, especially newsflow related to coronavirus in India or developed countries," said Gaurav Dua - SVP, Head - Capital Market Strategy at Sharekhan.', 'The key support level for Nifty is placed at 9,040.93, followed by 8,884.47. If the index moves up, key resistance levels to watch out for are 9,478.04 and 9,758.67.', "At the current juncture, there is no sign of reversal on charts, traders are advised to remain cautious till market doesn't settle, says Chandan Taparia of Motilal Oswal Financial Services.", 'Experts are of the view that the market is showing no signs of stability as the economic impact of coronavirus is likely to be significant for many major economies.', 'In the next couple of trading sessions if the Nifty trades below 9,100 consistently, then it can revisit panic lows of 8,555.', 'Companies in the entertainment, aviation, hospitality and travel sectors have started feeling the heat of coronavirus spread. Going forward, companies in other sectors could get impacted, if the spread of the virus is not contained in a relatively short span of time.', 'Regulators consider banning short-sales in order to curb volatility as the practice tends to push stock prices even lower.', 'As many as 400 stocks hit the lower circuit of BSE. These include Future Retail, Vakrangee, Indiabulls Ventures, Adani Green and Shilpa Medicare.', 'Yes Bank will be excluded from the Nifty50 index, while Shree Cement will be included on March 19 and the replacement will also be applicable to the Nifty50.', 'Overseas investors pulled out a net sum of Rs 24,776.36 crore from equities and Rs 13,199.54 crore from the debt segment between Mar 2-13, depositories data showed.', 'The Sensex closed 2,713.41 points lower at 31390.07, while Nifty ended at 9197.40, down 757.80 points.']

News: ['Key support level for Nifty is placed at 8208.05, followed by 7947.3. If the index moves up, key resistance levels to watch out for are 8928.55 and 9388.3.', 'India VIX closed with surge of 1.64 percent at 63.95 levels. Higher VIX beyond 50 zone suggests that volatile swings could continue in the market.', 'The Nifty formed a bearish candle and recorded a fresh breakdown as the index was not able to hold Friday the 13th’s low of 8,555.', 'Valuations are now looking comparatively good compared to what they have been in a long time, Jashan Arora of Master Capital Services said.', 'Sectorally, selling pressure was seen in banks, financials, as well as telecom stocks.', 'Mid-caps and small-caps were reeling under selling pressure. Their sectoral indices underperformed benchmark Sensex, with stocks falling up to 30 percent.', 'The benchmark index NIFTY50 has already corrected more than 3400 points (28 percent) from its lifetime high and more pain is expected along the way.', 'Most stocks are available at multi-year lows, the investors who want to invest in the market now can select the stocks based on their valuations and fundamental analysis, says Arora.', 'As many as 351 stocks hit the lower circuit of BSE. These include Future Retail, Vakrangee, Indiabulls Ventures, IRCTC, IndusInd Bank and Avenue Supermarts.', 'Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs have already predicted the world economy is headed for a recession. Clearly, the global pandemic initiated by the coronavirus has made bulls a near-extinct specie', 'At close, the Sensex was down 1,709.58 points or 5.59% at 28,869.51, while Nifty was down 425.55 points or 4.75% at 8,541.50.']

News: ['Key support level for Nifty is placed at 7,872.18, followed by 7,480.92. If the index moves up, key resistance levels to watch out for are 8,615.08 and 8,966.72.', 'Stock prices have come down to levels unimaginable just a month back. And yet few are willing to call a bottom, as authorities across the globe struggle to contain the epidemic.', 'A sharp correction in blue-chip counters should be considered as an opportunity for long- term investment, says Mazhar Mohammad.', 'Nifty formed a small bullish candle on the daily charts', "Amar Deo Singh of Angel Broking also said one shouldn't try to catch a falling knife all at once, let the markets settle down before buying value.", 'Timing this market through F&O, hoping for a bottom is futile. Trading probably makes sense through sound professional advice from our desk, but with low leverage and strict risk assessment and management.', 'Among stocks which listed in last one year, CSB Bank, IIFL Wealth Management, SBI Cards & Payment Services, Suven Pharmaceuticals, Ujjivan Small Finance Bank etc also hit all-time lows today.', 'Some amount of confidence building measures should be taken by the government, western countries already did the same, Ravi Dharamshi said.', 'The volatility index is up 13.48 percent at 72.58 level.', 'In the face of the massive selloff triggered by the coronavirus pandemic, experts are asking investors to stay away from the market and avoid bottom fishing.', 'Sensex ended 581.28 points lower at 28288.23, while Nifty fell 205.35 points to close at 8263.45.']

News: ['SEBI has revised position limits in equity index derivatives and the revised market norms to be effective for one month from March 23.', 'Traders should wait for at least one more positive close before considering short-term positions on long side, Mazhar Mohammad says.', 'But, the Sensex and the Nifty suffered their worst week since the 2008 financial crisis, plunging more than 12 percent each.', 'The state government has ordered the closure of shops and offices in some cities, including Mumbai.', 'ICICI Direct believes one should select strong balance sheet companies with low leverage and higher cash flows during these turbulent times.', 'The fundamental approach makes me believe that markets are reasonably valued and an investor can expect decent returns over the next two-three years, says Chandraprakash Padiyar of Tata Mutual Fund.', 'The domestic unit had closed at 75.12 against the US currency on March 19.', 'An intermittent rally in sectors like insurance, industrial gases & fuels and retail could be possible as the advance-decline ratio of these sectors is greater than or equal to 0.50 on MoM basis.', 'The top gainers included ITC and Power Grid Corp which jumped over 6 percent followed by Hindustan Unilever and ONGC which added over 4 percent each.', 'The Sensex ended 1,627.73 points higher at 29,915.96, while Nifty was up 482 points at 8,745.45.']

News: ['Key support level for Nifty is placed at 7,409.48, followed by 7,208.72. If the index moves up, key resistance levels to watch out for are 7,985.13 and 8,360.02.', 'As of now, there is no sign of reversal and thus traders should refrain bottom fishing in this market.', "Today's fall was in addition to more than 12 percent correction seen in previous week. Now the indices crashed nearly 38 percent from their record highs seen in January this year.", 'The Nifty50 which is trading at a 4-year low could see further selling pressure in the coming days, fear experts.', 'The inflation led recovery in earnings that most were factoring in, is also now likely to be pushed back. So, overall there is likely to be cut in earnings.', 'Several large-cap names are now available at distress valuations, investors should construct a portfolio of these names, says Jain.', 'Given the sharp fall in stock prices across sectors, most experts advised accumulating quality and fundamentally strong scrips with a long term perspective.', '"Valuations of high quality companies have become quite attractive. One needs to keep the faith and be a long-term bull in India," Nilesh Shah said.', 'Investors lost more than Rs 60 lakh crore of wealth in the last one month as the market itself crashed more than 35 percent on global turmoil led by the virus.', 'In order to curb the extreme volatility witnessed in the stock market, SEBI has introduced measures such as revising the market-wide position limit to 50 percent which will reduce fresh short positions in individual stocks.', 'Among the bank and financial stocks, shares of City Union Bank, Axis Bank, ICICI Bank, Federal Bank, IndusInd Bank and State Bank of India plunged over 10 percent.', 'Selling pressure was seen in sectors like Oil & Gas, Auto, Banks, Energy, IT, Consumer Durables, and capital goods stocks.', 'One relief rally in Bank Nifty towards 25,000 levels cannot be ruled out. Conversely, the confirmation of short-term reversal will be seen on a daily close above 22,500.', 'Axis Bank, IndusInd Bank and Bajaj Finance are the top losers while HDFC Bank, Reliance Industries, ICICI Bank, HDFC and TCS are the most active stocks.']

News: ['Key support level is placed at 7,896.15, followed by 7,474.45. If the index moves upward, key resistance levels to watch out for are 8,558.15 and 8,798.45.', 'With two consecutive days of gains, the Sensex recovered 2,896.88 points and Nifty 806.75 points from COVID-19-led lows of 25,638.9 and 7,511.1 seen on March 23.', 'Santosh Meena feels the ultimate trigger for the bulls will be any positive news in front of novel coronavirus.', 'Nifty formed a bullish candle on the daily charts, closes above 5-Days EMA for the first time since 20 Feb', 'Traders with a high-risk appetite are advised to make use of dip into 8,000–7,900 zone to create fresh long positions.', 'Among the sectoral indices, BSE Energy index surged over 12 percent while the Bankex and Finance indices jumped 8 percent. All sectoral indices were in the green.', "From the market's perspective, equity markets have nosedived with an acceleration never seen before. And it looks like a lot of the future uncertainty is already priced in.", 'Even if markets were in a freefall, as they are over the past few weeks, investors would want markets to remain open to freely enter and exit trades based on incoming piece of information and developments.', 'The top gainers include Maruti Suzuki and Reliance Industries which jumped over 6 percent each followed by Nestle India, Bharti Airtel and Tech Mahindra.', 'Morgan Stanley highlights 20 stocks in the focus list which include names like Bharti Airtel, Baja Auto, Maruti Suzuki, Motherson Sumi, Titan Company, Godrej Consumer, and ITC, among others.', 'Experts feel that investors should deploy a buy on dips strategy with resistance firmly placed near 42000 levels on the MCX Gold.', 'The Sensex rose 1,861.75 points to end at 28535.78, while Nifty was up 516.80 points to close at 8317.85.']

News: ['"From market and humanity kind of perspective, I would say it is a good step but highly inadequate compared to the rest of world," Srivastava said.', 'Positional traders should consider booking profits at around 8,900, says Mazhar Mohammad.', 'The S&P BSE Sensex closed with gains of 1410 points to end at 29,946, just a shade below 30,000.', 'With largest competitive leaders in the industry, it is a very rare to get such kind of opportunity, said Gunwani who hopes Indian investors stay invested having suffered by big lockdown after COVID-19.', 'The biggest loser is Sterling and Wilson Solar, down 88 percent from its high', 'The broader markets also gained momentum with the Nifty Midcap index rising 3.4 percent and Smallcap index climbing 4.5 percent.', "Sectors like F&B, hotels, tourism, and retail trade (~12% of India's GDP) sees a decline in the activity, said a Jefferies report.", 'If you are investing for the next five-ten years, then your focus should be on the opportunity and the way to harness it, says Jyoti Vaswani of Future Generali India Life Insurance.', 'Rebalancing of portfolio by reducing fixed income and increasing (at currently reduced prices) the equity exposure would be a sensible strategy.', 'Impact on retail investors of the 4 Ps which stands for Paisa, Pain, Pandemic, and Pledges amid the COVID-19 outbreak.', "An analysis of Google Trends suggests that interest in the term 'multibagger' is nearing the peak, which historically comes when market is going through a correction.", 'All the sectoral indices ended in the green. BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices rose over 3 percent each.', 'Early indication suggests 4-6 weeks of near-complete washout of corporate earnings. Household and business stress implies a very difficult situation even for Indian financials.']

News: ['Market benchmarks Sensex and Nifty closed in the red on March 30 as fears of recession kept investors away from riskier equities.', 'Key support level for Nifty is placed at 8,158.07, followed by 8,035.03. If the index starts moving up, key resistance levels to watch out for are 8,490.07 and 8,699.03.', 'Big opportunities will come over time, but the market volatility is not going to end anytime soon, says Amit Khurana of Dolat Capital.', 'The broader market outperformed as the S&P BSE Midcap index fell 2.1 percent while the S&P BSE Smallcap index was down just 1.75 percent.', 'Traders are advised to wait for further clues to emerge over next 2- 3 trading sessions before initiating trading bets in any of the directions.', 'The rapid increase in infected cases by novel coronavirus or COVID-19 was the major worry for investors globally as it butchered all asset classes and forced the world to fall into recession.', 'This week is a holiday-shortened one and we do not see this volatility easing anytime soon. The probable range for the Nifty index could be 7,600-9,500 zone.', 'Earnings will get impacted because of the sectors that have more exposure to the global scenario like IT and some other export related companies, will also be impacted.', 'With stimulus measures announced, the focus is back on the coronavirus outbreak and its impact on the economy.', 'Rebalancing in ETFs and pension fund buying support helped the markets rally. The RBI announced an out-of-turn rate cut and measures to improve liquidity in the system.', 'Most of these high dividend-paying companies have healthy cash reserves which could be utilized for paying dividends in difficult times as well when the core businesses get impacted.', 'Stoicism is a great discipline for investors in these uncertain times', 'Except pharma and FMCG all other sectoral indices ended in the red.', 'Formation of positive divergence in RSI on a daily time frame supported reversing of prices, as index managed to take support from the strong demand zone standing around 7,500-7,300 levels on the higher time frame.']

News: ['Traders should create long positions in the index and look for bigger targets, says Mazhar Mohammad.', 'The rally was fierce and was seen in all sectors with Bankex and Energy gaining over 10 percent each.', 'Amar Ambani of YES Securities feels the year 2020 will continue to see high volatility even in the aftermath of the health crisis.', 'At the moment, Atul Suri feels the bigger story is not that where the index is going and how the index will bottom out.', 'India could still be amongst the fastest growing Large economies over next decade providing an attractive avenue for global Long term investors at a time when global growth has been very low.', "In my opinion, a sensible way to invest in these markets is to phase out one's total investible surplus of risk capital over few months.", 'Sectorally, the action was seen in healthcare, IT, Realty, Bankex, Telecom, and Auto stocks which are trading with gains of over 4 percent each.', 'Individual investors should remember that every crisis is an opportunity. The present situation is no different, should you choose to wisely seize it and use it to your advantage.', 'All the sectoral indices are trading in the green. BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices rose 3-4 percent.']
